page.title: 07ALLERGIES IN SCHOOL CHILDREN
page.content: A nurse who tests for allergies told our teacher that this area of the country is the worst for such complaints. Our class seems to prove the point. As part of our Domesday work we went for a walk on a hot day on footpaths between fields. Many of us suffered so badly that 8 of us out of 24 had to go a different way back to school along the roads through the village away from the fields. Susan's eyes puffed up and Sheridan came out in a rash. Louise and Sarah had to use their asthma spinhalers and Debbie was wheezing with her asthma. Elaine did not even come because the grass makes her eczema worse. We found that the childrens' hayfever was worse on a footpath between a field of wheat and a high hedge. {LOUISE HOOPER (11) {
